summary: This document is a summary of a March 3, 2021 call between Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) and Dr. Rocchio, a clinical psychologist specializing in trauma. It details Dr. Rocchio's extensive qualifications, career history, and expertise in treating and assessing survivors of sexual trauma, particularly childhood sexual abuse, for use in legal proceedings.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: A clinical psychologist with 25+ years of experience specializing in the assessment and treatment of sexual trauma, particularly childhood sexual abuse. She is the president-elect of the APA trauma committee and has been consulted by prosecutors (AUSAs) regarding her expertise.

events.title: Prosecutor Call with Trauma Expert
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) held a call with Dr. Rocchio to discuss her qualifications and expertise in treating survivors of sexual trauma.

keyFacts: Dr. Rocchio has specialized in trauma, including childhood sexual abuse, for her entire 25+ year career, with 50-80% of her clients being victims.
She has treated and evaluated 'hundreds upon hundreds' of trauma victims and takes on at least 20 clients per year.
Dr. Rocchio has specific forensic training for assessing trauma in criminal and civil legal settings and has been involved in multiple such cases.
She holds leadership positions in the field, being the president-elect of the APA trauma committee and a fellow of that organization.
The document appears to be part of a prosecution effort to qualify Dr. Rocchio as an expert witness in a case involving sexual trauma.
